pros: I liked everything they offered
cons: I have nothing bad to say

pros: Small University with a lovely campus. Friendly co-workers, and easy to build relationships with other teams and stakeholders. Good flexible working.
cons: Not much room for progression unless you know the right people (what others have said about nepotism is largely true). The pay is not on par with other Universities, which is a big issue. The Chief Information Officer did not have student and stakeholder best interests at heart, it seemed mainly about expanding the empire and looking good in front of and pleasing senior management. I did not feel listened to or valued.

pros: The people who work here are fantastic and are open to new thinking and collaboration.
cons: Some of the facilities are a little run down.

review_title: Don't judge a book by its cover
pros: York is a nice place and the university grounds are very well kept.
cons: I echo what another former employee has said on here: nepotism has a BIG role to play. There is no room to grow here, as family members and friends will often get positions when they become available. Poor value for money for students- far too often lectures/lessons are cancelled. Some staff not around to help them, others are left stressed and working many more hours than they are getting paid for.

pros: Good atmosphere and nice staff
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Varied work. Flexible hours. Good pay for students - higher than national minimum for under 21s.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Digital Media Student in York, England
pros:
- Lovely grounds 
- Amazing Staff
cons: none, lovely place to work and study

review_title: Great place great setting great job
pros: The environment of the campus and its location in the city
cons: Workload at certain times of the year

pros: Very little in the way of pros
cons: Poorly run, no strategy, race to the bottom.

pros: Ability to work on many service delivery teams - wide range of experience to be gained.
cons: Quite a large business and therefore sometimes can be lack of communication between departments.

pros: Good pay and great holidays
cons: Overall a nice environment but some nasty people around

job_title: Global Guidance Ambassador in York, England
pros: Great pay, lovely people, flexible hours
cons: Sometimes don't get enough hours

job_title: Head of School in York, England
pros: Lovely people who really care about what they do
cons: Weak culture, so bad behaviour is tolerated and good practice is not rewarded.

review_title: It was a really enjoyable experience.
job_title: Temporary English Language Tutor in York, England
pros:
Supportive, fun, kind colleagues
An environment where people share ideas and best practice, and are not judgemental
Good resources
You are encouraged to be creative, work as a team, experiment with ideas; you don't have to follow the coursebook rigidly or use a particular method
Good rate of pay and benefits for temporary work
Very supportive admin staff
Lovely students from a wide number of countries
cons:
Not all classes are taught within the main International building and rooms outside International are not equipped as language teaching rooms, which means having to cart resources around and teaching in bare-walled, unstimulating environments.
HR and payroll don't seem to communicate very well and temporary staff can experience problems with getting paid on time.

review_title: The best environment I've worked in
job_title: Senior Careers Advisor in York, England
pros:
Opportunities for growth and personal development (if you take them)

An environment that really cares about doing the best for the students

Close links to the city and local community
cons:
Not a lot of room for career progression in many departments due to small teams and lack of funding

Management can be hit and miss - I experienced both the very best and very worst line management of my life in two different departments here.

pros: YSJ has a brilliant culture of encouraging growth and exploring the potential of its employees. They have an excellent mentor system for new starters and an introduction programme to ease you in and train you up. The employees here are exceptionally friendly and respectful. Everyone is considered on equal terms. YSJ is a fun and dynamic place to work with a wonderful student population. Pay is fair and employees are encouraged to climb the ladder and explore other jobs within the uni. Community feel.
cons: After a massive restructure, opportunities for career growth are now more limited within the uni. As a small uni, pay is lower than compared to larger universities.

review_title: Link Tutor in UK Primary Schools
job_title: Link Tutor for Teacher-training Courses in Withernsea, England
pros: In schools, I work with and alongside students and teaching Mentors and  being supported by York St John office and academic staff is a must. Thankfullythere is always a good deal of advice and help from them.
cons: YSJ staff are always incredibly busy and getting an early reply to emails is sometimes a problem.

pros: Wonderful people; benefits are good (public sector pension, time off when the University closes at Christmas with no requirement it comes out of your AL etc..)
cons: Salary is poor, constant upheaval (3 line managers in 7 months), nepotism is becoming more and more evident with it starting in Senior management

pros: Small, friendly and a real sense of community. Everyone pulling together to achieve a similar goal
cons: In many areas, we're one person deep, so there are key pressure points, but most of the time you don't mind as we all want to do a good job!

pros: Friendly colleagues, nice friendly culture. Most of the people there seem to genuinely care about their jobs and helping students.
cons: Some departments are short-staffed and take on too much work. They pay a grade lower than most Yorkshire universities and there often isn't much progression. Especially for support staff.

pros: York St John uni is an inclusive and welcoming environment and to be able to work for them for three years was great. I got to meet lots of new people, build on my communication skills and enjoy my job.
cons: There was none, it was a great place to work.

review_title: Great staff and community; leadership could do better
pros: Commitment to the student experience; Committed staff; great community; find friends as well as colleagues
cons: Leadership tend to pursue own interests over the University's which creates vulnerability; leadership don't listen.

pros:
New University
Generally a very positive teaching university with growing research base
cons:
New University
The research side of academic life is sometimes undervalued.

pros: Friendly Environment supportive Equality and Diversity Career Development Entertainment Recognition Employee Welfare
cons: Non Frequent Timing Recommendations Delays

review_title: The worst college (not really a university) one could work
pros: There were some nice academics and admin colleagues
cons: Nepotism, bullying, active harassment, deceiving of staff and students
